title: Trump indicted on 37 federal charges for classified documents
summary:
Special Counsel Jack Smith's grand jury indicted Donald Trump on 37 federal charges related
to mishandling classified documents, marking the first federal criminal indictment of a
former U.S. president. Charges included 31 counts of willful retention of national defense
information under the Espionage Act, conspiracy to obstruct justice, and making false
statements. Walt Nauta was also indicted on 6 counts.

notes:
The indictment alleged Trump willfully retained documents containing the nation's most
sensitive secrets, including nuclear programs, showed them to unauthorized persons on at
least two occasions, and tried to obstruct the investigation. A superseding indictment on
July 27, 2023 added 3 additional charges and a third defendant, Carlos De Oliveira.
